part.content: Chapter I : PRELIMINARY. Sec. 1 - 5.
Chapter II : CONSTITUTION OF CRIMINAL COURTS AND OFFICES. Sec. 6 - 25A.
Chapter III : POWER OF COURTS Sec. 26 - 35.
Chapter IVA : POWERS OF SUPERIOR OFFICERS OF POLICE. Sec. 36.
Chapter IVB : AID TO THE MAGISTRATES AND THE POLICE. Sec. 37 - 40.
Chapter V : ARREST OF PERSONS Sec. 41 - 60A.
Chapter VI : PROCESSES TO COMPEL APPEARANCE. Sec. 61 - 90.
A. Summons. Sec. 61 - 69.
B. Warrant of arrest. Sec. 70 - 81.
C.Proclamation and attachment. Sec. 82 - 86.
D. Other rules regarding processes. Sec. 87 - 90.
Chapter VII : PROCESSES TO COMPEL THE PRODUCTION OF THINGS Sec. 91 - 105.
A. Summons to produce. Sec. 91 - 92.
B. Search - warrants. Sec. 93 - 98.
C. General provisions relating to searches. Sec. 99 - 101.
D. Miscellaneous. Sec. 102 - 105.
Chapter VIIA : RECIPROCAL ARRANGEMENTS FOR ASSISTANCE IN CERTAIN MATTERS AND PROCEDURE FOR ATTACHMENT AND FORFEITURE OF PROPERTY. Sec. 105A - 105L.
Chapter VIII : SECURITY FOR KEEPING THE PEACE AND FOR GOOD BEHAVIOUR. Sec. 106 - 124.
Chapter IX : ORDER FOR MAINTENANCE OF WIVES, CHILDREN AND PARENTS. Sec. 125 - 128.
Chapter X : MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC ORDER AND TRANQUILLITY. Sec. 129 - 148.
A. Unlawful assemblies. Sec. 129 - 132.
B. Public nuisances. Sec. 133 - 143.
C. Urgent cases of nuisance or apprehended danger. Sec. 144 - 144A.
D. Disputes as to immovable property. Sec. 145 - 148.
Chapter XI : PREVENTIVE ACTION OF THE POLICE. Sec. 149 - 153.
Chapter XII : INFORMATION TO THE POLICE AND THEIR POWERS TO INVESTIGATE. Sec. 154 - 176.
Chapter XIII : JURISDICTION OF THE CRIMINAL COURTS IN INQUIRIES AND TRIALS. Sec. 177 - 189.
Chapter XIV : CONDITIONS REQUISITE FOR INITIATION OF PROCEEDING. Sec. 190 - 199.
Chapter XV : COMPLAINTS TO MAGISTRATES. Sec. 200 - 203.
Chapter XVI : COMMENCEMENT OF PROCEEDINGS BEFORE MAGISTRATES. Sec. 204 - 210.
Chapter XVII : THE CHARGE Sec. 211 - 224.
A. Form of charges. Sec. 211 - 217.
B. Joinder of charges. Sec. 218 - 224.
Chapter XVIII : TRIAL BEFORE A COURT OF SESSION. Sec. 225 - 237.
Chapter XIX : TRIAL OF WARRANT - CASES BY MAGISTRATES Sec. 238 - 250.
A. Cases instituted on a police report. Sec. 238 - 243.
B. Cases instituted otherwise than on police report. Sec. 244 - 247.
C. Conclusion of trial. Sec. 248 - 250.
Chapter XX : TRIAL OF SUMMONS CASES BY MAGISTRATES. Sec. 251 - 259.
Chapter XXI : SUMMARY TRIALS. Sec. 260 - 265.
Chapter XXIA : PLEA BARGAINING. Sec. 265A - 265L.
Chapter XXII : ATTENDANCE OF PERSONS CONFINED OR DETAINED IN PRISONS. Sec. 266 - 271.
Chapter XXIII : EVIDENCE IN INQUIRIES AND TRIALS. Sec. 272 - 299.
A. - Mode of taking and recording evidence. Sec. 272 - 283.
B. - Commissions for the examination of witnesses. Sec. 284 - 299.
Chapter XXIV : GENERAL PROVISIONS AS TO INQUIRIES AND TRIALS. Sec. 300 - 327.
Chapter XXV : PROVISIONS AS TO ACCUSED PERSONS OF UNSOUND MIND. Sec. 328 - 339.
Chapter XXVI : PROVISIONS AS TO OFFENCES AFFECTING THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE. Sec. 340 - 352.
ChapterXXVII : THE JUDGEMENT. Sec. 353 - 365.
Chapter XXVIII : SUBMISSION OF DEATH SENTENCES FOR CONFIRMATION. Sec. 366 - 371.
Chapter XXIX : APPEALS. Sec. 372 - 394.
Chapter XXX : REFERENCE AND REVISION. Sec. 395 - 405.
Chapter XXXI : TRANSFER OF CRIMINAL CASES. Sec. 406 - 412.
Chapter XXXII : EXECUTION, SUSPENSION, REMISSION AND COMMUTATION OF SENTENCES. Sec. 413 - 435.
A. Death sentences. Sec. 413 - 416.
B. Imprisonment. Sec. 417 - 420.
C. Levy of fine. Sec. 421 - 424.
D. General provisions regarding execution. Sec. 425 - 431.
E. Suspension, remission and commutation of sentences. Sec. 432 - 435.
Chapter XXXIII : PROVISIONS AS TO BAIL AND BONDS. Sec. 436 - 450.
Chapter XXXIV : DISPOSAL OF PROPERTY. Sec. 451 - 459.
Chapter XXXV : IRREGULAR PROCEEDINGS. Sec. 460 - 466.
Chapter XXXVI : LIMITATION FOR TAKING COGNIZANCE OF CERTAIN OFFENCES. Sec. 461 - 473.
Chapter XXXVII : LIMITATION FOR TAKING COGNIZANCE OF CERTAIN OFFENCES. Sec. 474 - 484.
THE FIRST SCHEDULE
THE SECOND SCHEDULE
